required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Topical ABI-1968 in Subjects With Precancerous Cervical Lesions From Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Infection.
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Multiple-Dose, Dose Escalation Study To Evaluate Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Topical ABI-1968 in Participants With Cervical High Grade Squamous Intraepithelial Lesions

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the use of ABI-1968, a topical cream, in the treatment of cervical precancerous lesions in females without human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety & Tolerability of ABI-1968 for the treatment of cHSIL
primary_outcome.description: Number of Adverse Events related to treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Systemic exposure to ABI-1968 Topical Cream following topical application to the cervix.
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of ABI-1968 over time

other_outcome.measure: Histopathology of areas with biopsy-proven disease
other_outcome.description: Number of subjects with complete and or partial regression of cHSIL by Histopathology

other_outcome.measure: Changes in HPV viral load following multiple doses of ABI-1968 Topical Cream
other_outcome.description: Changes from baseline in HPV viral load following multiple doses of ABI-1968 Topical Cream

clinical_study.condition: HSIL, High Grade Squamous Intraepithelial Lesions

arm_group.description: Topical ABI-1968 Cream applied at Day 1, Day 8, Day 15 and Day 22
Topical ABI-1968 Cream applied at Day 1, Day 8, Day 15 and Day 22
New Topical ABI-1968 Formulation applied at Day 1, Day 8, Day 15 and Day 22
New Topical ABI-1968 Formulation applied at Day 1, Day 8, Day 15 and Day 22
New Topical ABI-1968 Formulation applied at Day 1, Day 8, Day 15 and Day 22

intervention.description: Multiple Doses of Topical ABI-1968 Cream with 4 once weekly doses administered in up to 5 Cohorts

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Women, 25 to 50 years old.
2. Biopsy-confirmed cervical HSIL that is p16+ within 60 days of enrollment (dosing) with no evidence of invasive cancer in any specimen.
3. Colposcopy is satisfactory based on visualization of the entire squamo-columnar junction (SCJ). The borders of all lesions must be completely visible.
4. The upper limit of the visible (usually aceto-white) lesion is within 3 quadrants or less at screening.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Women who are pregnant, plan to become pregnant in the next 4 months, or lactating females.
2. HIV positive (tested at screening visit or within 3 months of screening visit).
3. Resolution of visible CIN lesion prior to enrollment.
4. ECC positive for glandular disease (adenocarcinoma in situ) or invasive cancer.
5. History of cervical cancer, colposcopy suspicious for cancer, any prior treatment of CIN, or hysterectomy.

condition_browse.mesh_term: Squamous Intraepithelial Lesions of the Cervix
